text: let me elaborate uh on how these rules
apply for example to corporations
publicly traded corporations many of us
have uh the sense that uh the Wall
Street Bankers are toned deaf how could
they be giving billions of dollars in
bonuses when the taxpayers have bailed
them out people the economy is suffering
millions of people are unemployed well
people who say that are confused about
how governance Works let's look at how a
corporation works well we the people
certainly uh are not the ones who get to
decide whether a CEO keeps his or her
job or not uh the shareholders except
under unusual circumstances are not the
folks who get to decide the folks who
get to decide are Senior Management the
people right under them and the uh board
of directors they are the folks who get
the bonuses because they're the folks
who keep the leadership in office so if
one wants to change uh how corporations
work um occupying Washington Square
Parks probably not going to do it but
organizing uh shareholders on for
example uh the equivalent of uh a
Facebook page for each individual
Corporation where shareholders can
coordinate without any great expense to
themselves and organize their own proxy
battles uh why that would make a
difference in corporate governance
because they do have the votes to
control outcomes it's just that the
shareholders give their votes away to
the corporate proxy because they haven't
organized
